DOCNAME: ČESKÝ AND KOTIK v. THE CZECH REPUBLIC
JUDGES: Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: The applicants , Mr Libor Český ( application no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , “ the first applicant ” ) and Mr PERSON ( application no . DATE , “ the second applicant ” ) , are NORP nationals who were born in DATE and DATE respectively , and live in GPE and GPE respectively . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON , from ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . The first round of criminal proceedings

At the beginning of DATE the NORP authorities investigated a case of CARDINAL missing persons . On CARDINAL and DATE a certain PERSON was heard , who stated that he and the applicants had decided to rob these people in the flat of CARDINAL of them . B. did not know how the QUANTITY persons had been killed , but he saw their bodies being removed from the apartment . According to B. the applicants had removed the bodies . CARDINAL seven witnesses PERSON . , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON B. and PERSON ) were heard in absence of the first applicant and his lawyer . On DATE the applicants were charged with complicity in robbery . On DATE , the second applicant was placed in custody . On DATE ORG ( městský soud ) ordered the first applicant 's arrest . At the same time , a lawyer was appointed to him .
On DATE the first applicant was arrested in GPE and , pursuant to an extradition warrant , he was extradited on DATE . On DATE , he was placed in custody .

On DATE ORG ( městský státní zástupce ) charged the applicants and B. with robbery before ORG . He requested the court to hear CARDINAL witnesses and to consider further evidence taken during the investigation .
On DATE the first applicant 's lawyer requested the hearing of further witnesses and the appointment of a medical expert .

On DATE ORG convicted the applicants and B. of robbery . It sentenced the first applicant to DATE imprisonment , ordered the confiscation of his car and fined him CZK MONEY ( EUR CARDINAL ) , and sentenced the second applicant to DATE imprisonment . The applicants declined to give evidence . The court found it established that in DATE the applicants and PERSON had killed the QUANTITY persons and stolen CZK MONEY ( EUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) . It stressed that the first applicant had already been convicted of robbery in DATE .

On DATE ORG ( vrchní soud ) quashed the first instance judgment and remitted the case to ORG for further investigations . It considered that ORG had not established all the relevant facts of the case with sufficient certainty .
CARDINAL . The second round of criminal proceedings
On DATE the investigator ordered a medical examination of the first applicant 's mental health and appointed CARDINAL experts for that purpose .

On DATE ORG informed the applicants and PERSON that , having re - assessed the charges , he had decided to charge them with murder . At trial , the applicants and PERSON proposed that further evidence be produced .

On DATE ORG convicted the applicants and B. of robbery and sentenced the first applicant as a very dangerous recidivist to DATE imprisonment and ordered that his car be confiscated , and sentenced the second applicant to DATE imprisonment and DATE imprisonment .

On DATE the High Court quashed this judgment and remitted the case to ORG for a new decision on the merits . It considered that the lower court had not properly assessed the evidence , had not established all the relevant facts and had based its judgment on evidence which had not been produced before it . ORG determined the evidence which had to be assessed .
CARDINAL . The third round of criminal proceedings

On DATE ORG again convicted the applicants and B. of robbery and sentenced the first applicant to DATE imprisonment and ordered the confiscation of his car , again sentencing PERSON to DATE imprisonment and the second applicant to DATE imprisonment .

On DATE ORG quashed this judgment and sent the case back to the first instance , ordering that the case be heard by another chamber . It found , inter alia , that ORG had not respected ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE and had practically copied its previous judgment .
CARDINAL . The fourth round of criminal proceedings

In a judgment of DATE comprising CARDINAL pages , ORG convicted the applicants and PERSON of theft of CZK CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) , sentenced the first applicant as a very dangerous recidivist to DATE imprisonment and ordered the confiscation of his car , the second applicant to DATE imprisonment and PERSON to DATE imprisonment .

The court heard CARDINAL witnesses and read out statements of CARDINAL other witnesses ( including ( PERSON , PERSON . , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON and PERSON ) 's decision of DATE . Among other things , the court did not take into account the first CARDINAL hearings of PERSON held on CARDINAL and DATE .

At the trial , the first applicant requested that CARDINAL further witnesses be heard to clarify his financial situation at the relevant time . The court rejected his request , stating that the proposed witness evidence would not affect its view of the applicant 's guilt , its finding being based on completely different and more relevant facts .

The second applicant argued that the bank strips , with which wads of banknotes handled by him and the first applicant had been bundled together , had disappeared from the case file . The court accepted that there were some gaps in the file , which contained CARDINAL pages . It was , however , of the opinion that this did not affect the state of the evidence , which had been based on the witness statements and other material evidence .

On DATE ORG , having held a hearing on CARDINAL and DATE , quashed the first - instance judgment and decided anew finding the CARDINAL accused guilty of theft of MONEY CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) . It stated that the first - instance court had established all the relevant facts of the case and had assessed the evidence in an exhaustive and convincing manner . Nevertheless , it considered that the first applicant and PERSON could not be classified as extremely dangerous recidivists within the meaning of LAW referring in this respect to a significant delay which had elapsed between the crime and the conviction of the CARDINAL accused , which reduced the degree of danger the crime presented for society . It therefore reduced the applicants ' prison sentence to DATE .

On DATE the second applicant filed a constitutional appeal ( ústavní stížnost ) alleging a violation of LAW ( right to liberty ) , LAW , LAW and LAW , DATE and DATE ( presumption of innocence , defence rights and right to remain silent ) of LAW ( Listina základních práv a svobod ) .
On DATE the first applicant lodged a constitutional appeal in which he alleged a violation of LAW ( right to liberty ) and LAW ( right to remain silent ) of the LAW .
On DATE and DATE respectively , ORG ( GPE PERSON ) found the applicants ' appeals clearly unsubstantiated .

On DATE and DATE respectively , ORG rejected the applicants ' requests for re - opening of the criminal proceedings . On DATE and DATE respectively , ORG dismissed the applicants ' complaints against these CARDINAL decisions .

On DATE the Minister of ORG filed a complaint in the first applicant 's favour , alleging a breach of law ( stížnost pro porušení zákona ) . The Minister 's complaint was dismissed by ORG ( PERSON ) on DATE .

The relevant domestic law and practice concerning remedies as regards the length of judicial proceedings are stated in the ORG 's decision in the case of PERSON v. GPE , no . MONEY ( dec . ) , § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL , CARDINAL DATE CARDINAL).²
